title: BLT Fish Sandwiches for Two
summary: You can never have too many main course recipes, so give BLT Fish Sandwiches for Two a try. Watching your figure? This dairy free recipe has 830 calories, 63g of protein, and 32g of fat per serving. This recipe serves 2 and costs $5.9 per serving. From preparation to the plate, this recipe takes about 25 minutes. This recipe is liked by 1 foodies and cooks. valentin day will be even more special with this recipe. Head to the store and pick up lettuce, hoagie rolls, tilapia fillets, and a few other things to make it today. All things considered, we decided this recipe deserves a spoonacular score of 66%. This score is good. Similar recipes include BLT Salad, BLT Salad, and Fish Sandwiches.

winePairing.pairingText: Pinot Grigio, Gruener Veltliner, and Pinot Noir are great choices for Fish. Fish is as diverse as wine, so it's hard to pick wines that go with every fish. A crisp white wine, such as a pinot grigio or Grüner Veltliner, will suit any delicately flavored white fish. Meaty, strongly flavored fish such as salmon and tuna can even handle a light red wine, such as a pinot noir. The Alsace Willm Pinot Gris Reserve with a 4.4 out of 5 star rating seems like a good match. It costs about 16 dollars per bottle.

productMatches.title: Alsace Willm Pinot Gris Reserve
productMatches.description: An intense golden color with hints of ocher, the wine has a nose of ripe fruit, quince. In the mouth the attack is both supple and full, with notes of honey and spices. The final perfectly balances sugar and acidity.Pair this wine alongside pan-fried foie gras, grilled or roasted white meats (pork, veal), rabbit, poultry in cream sauce, smoked fish, mushroom dishes such as risotto.

instructions: Spray medium nonstick skillet with cooking spray; heat over medium-high heat.  Sprinkle fish with pepper.  Place in skillet; cook 8 minutes or until fish flakes easily with fork (145F), turning once.                Meanwhile, combine mayonnaise and mustard in small bowl.  Spread 1 tablespoon mustard mixture on bottom half of each roll.                Place lettuce leaves and fish fillets on bottom halves of rolls.  Top each with 1 slice bacon and 2 pieces tomato.  Close sandwiches with top halves of rolls.  Serve immediately.

steps.step: Spray medium nonstick skillet with cooking spray; heat over medium-high heat.
Place in skillet; cook 8 minutes or until fish flakes easily with fork (145F), turning once.
Meanwhile, combine mayonnaise and mustard in small bowl.
Spread 1 tablespoon mustard mixture on bottom half of each roll.
Place lettuce leaves and fish fillets on bottom halves of rolls.  Top each with 1 slice bacon and 2 pieces tomato.  Close sandwiches with top halves of rolls.
